dsl

Class Actor<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • dsl.Actor<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the payload this Actor works with.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Buffered, ConcentratorActor, ReceivingActor, SendingActor, SmartMeterActor, TransportingActor

    public class Actor<P>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class executes a protocol description as one of its participants, using a CommunicationResource to access the network. An Actor can be initialized without specifying any protocol or resource, which can be useful when extending the class or writing factories. However, in order to the Actor to be able to perform, it must eventually be loaded with a Part to interpret and a CommunicationResource to access the network. Unloaded actors throw an exception when requested to perform. On the other side, Actors cannot change the part they interpret nor the resource they use once they are loaded (i.e., they are immutable in that respect). This enhances the object's thread safety.

    Since Actors are sequential units in nature, they only need one thread to run. Do not use the same Actor in different threads! This might lead to unexpected behavior. Also, if the part to be interpreted starts by receiving a message (i.e., it corresponds to a passive role), using perform() directly may cause the program to lock for a long period of time, even indefinitely. In this case, consider using Server, an Actor pool, instead.

    Author:
    rongomai
    See Also:
    Server, Part

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Actor.AlreadyLoadedException
      An exception raised when the Actor is asked to load another Part.
      static class  Actor.NotLoadedException
      An exception raised when the Actor is requested to perform() but it does not have any Part to interpret.

        private java.lang.String[] addressMap
        The current address mapping ordered by character id. This is set initially to the content of initialAddressMap and may be altered along the run.
        See Also:
        initialAddressMap

      • addressBuffer

        private java.lang.String[] addressBuffer
        A mapping of yet unconfirmed addresses ordered by character id. After a message is marked as accepted (i.e, non spurious), the address is moved away from this buffer.
        See Also:
        addressMap

      • searchStack

        private short[] searchStack
        A stack to search the incoming message graph.

      • parent

        private short[] parent
        A parent set to build the search tree of the incoming message graph.

      • sent

        private java.util.BitSet sent
        A set marking messages already sent.

      • maxTimes

        private int[] maxTimes
        Stores the maximum arrival time for each incoming message. A position is set to -1 if the corresponding message is not expected to arrive due to causality constraints.

      • beginTime

        private long beginTime
        Stores the time the current run started.

      • expiryQueue

        private java.util.PriorityQueue<java.lang.Short> expiryQueue
        A priority queue to store incoming messages according to their expiration date.

        communicationResource - the CommunicationResource to be used as the means of exchanging messages.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(Part part,
                 CommunicationResource<P> communicationResource)
        Initializes an yet uninitialized Actor whith an empty address map.
        Parameters:
        part - the Part to be interpreted.
        communicationResource - the CommunicationResource to be used as the means of exchanging messages.
        Throws:
        Actor.AlreadyLoadedException - in case the object has already been loaded.
        See Also:
        load(Part, CommunicationResource, Map)

        Parameters:

        communicationResource - the CommunicationResource to be used as the means of exchanging messages.
        initialAddressMap - the initial address map to be loaded at every run.

      • perform

        public void perform()
        Performs a round of the protocol as described in the Part object supplied.
        Throws:
        Actor.NotLoadedException - in case the object has not yet been initialized.
        See Also:
        load(Part, CommunicationResource, Map)

      • performWithoutResetting

        public void performWithoutResetting()
        Performs a round of the protocol as described in the Part object supplied, but does not resets the object to its initial state in the end. Use this only if you are shore of what you are doing. Prefer using perform() instead.
        Throws:
        Actor.NotLoadedException - in case the object has not yet been initialized.
        See Also:
        load(Part, CommunicationResource, Map), perform(), reset()

      • receiveMessages

        private Node receiveMessages(java.util.BitSet initials)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Receives messages until a path of confirmed (i.e., possibly not spurious) has been found from one of the messages marked as initial in the BitSet provided to an active Node.
        Parameters:
        initials - the BitSet of initial incoming messages to be received.
        Returns:
        the active Node found (this is the next action in the execution path).
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - it the current thread is interrupted.

      • getConnectivityProof

        private java.util.BitSet getConnectivityProof(java.util.BitSet initials)
        Establishes whether any messages can still be received. This method looks for a path from any of the initial messages provided and tries to find a path of receivable messages to a Node. This path, if non-empty, serves as proof that it is still reasonable to wait for new messages to arrive (instead of, say, raising a ReceiveException).
        Parameters:
        initials - a BitSet with the positions to start the search from set.
        Returns:
        a BitSet with the positions in the proof path set.

      • searchForFinal

        private Node searchForFinal(short messageId)
        Does a search for a final message in the incoming message graph that is connected to the message id provided. The connection has to be done through messages that arrived but were not confirmed yet.
        Parameters:
        messageId - the id of the beginning of the search.
        Returns:
        the next action in the execution path if it was found; null otherwise.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the actor back to it's initial state (addresses set to the ones of the initial map, no messages sent, no messages received).

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(java.lang.String receiver,
                 java.lang.String name)
        Sends a message.
        Parameters:
        receiver - the character identifier of the receiver.
        name - the name of the message.

      • ongoingRunEvent

        private boolean ongoingRunEvent(FullMessage<P> inMessage)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method is a receive event that elects all messages pertaining to the current protocol round. It decides whether the associated message is to be processed or not and, if yes, it processes it.
        Parameters:
        inMessage - the received message to be tested.
        Returns:
        true in case the message pertains to an active run.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the running thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        CommunicationResource.addReceiveEvent(communications.ReceiveEvent)

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Stops the run by making the actor stop listening to messages.

      • getMessage

        public P getMessage(java.lang.String messageName)
        Gets the content of a given incoming message. Returns null in case the message has not arrived.

        Be careful: do not use this method to check if messages have arrived or not: message contents can be null. Use hasMessage(String) instead.

        Parameters:
        messageName - the name of the message.
        Returns:
        the content of that message or null if the message was not received.
        See Also:
        hasMessage(String)

      • hasMessage

        public boolean hasMessage(java.lang.String messageName)
        Checks if a given incoming message has arrived.
        Parameters:
        messageName - the name of the message to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the message has arrived and is non spurious, false otherwise.

                       P payload)
        Sets the content of an outgoing message.
        Parameters:
        messageName - the name of the outgoing message.
        payload - the payload to be sent with that message.

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.lang.String identifier,
                       java.lang.String address)
        Sets the address of a character. This method has only effect for this run; to make the change persistent, use setInitialAddress(String, String).
        Parameters:
        identifier - the character identifier.
        address - the String representation of the address.
        See Also:
        setInitialAddress(String, String)

      • setInitialAddress

        public void setInitialAddress(java.lang.String identifier,
                              java.lang.String address)
        Sets the address of a character. This method affects the initial state of all rounds. To make a temporary change to the address map, see setAddress(String, String).
        Parameters:
        identifier - the character's identifier.
        address - the String representation of the address.
        See Also:
        setAddress(String, String)

        public java.lang.String getCharacter()

        Returns:
        the identifier of the character.

      • setRunId

        public void setRunId(long runId)
        Sets the run id. Run ids are attributed automatically, therefore, use this method only if you really need to. Changing the run id in the middle of the run will cause unexpected behavior.
        Parameters:
        runId - the new run id.

      • getRunId

        public long getRunId()
        Gets the current run id.
        Returns:
        a long representing the id.
